hints.label: rem-curvature-topology-bridge
hints.title: Curvature-Topology Dictionary
hints.content:
1210: :label: rem-curvature-topology-bridge
1211: 
1212: This document ([24_topological_invariants.md](24_topological_invariants.md)) is complementary to [curvature.md](curvature.md):
1213: 
1214: **Curvature → Topology** (local to global):
1215: - **Gauss-Bonnet**: Integrated curvature gives Euler characteristic
1216: 
1217: $$
1218: \int_M K \, dA = 2\pi \chi(M)
1219: 
1220: $$
1221: 
1222: - **Deficit angles**: Discrete curvature at vertices sums to topology
1223: 
1224: $$
1225: \sum_i \delta_i = 2\pi \chi
1226: 
1227: $$
1228: 
1229: - **Chern-Gauss-Bonnet**: Chern classes computed from curvature 2-forms
1230: 
1231: **Topology → Curvature** (global constraints on local geometry):
1232: - **Myers Theorem**: Positive Ricci curvature + finite diameter → $\pi_1$ finite
1233: - **Bonnet-Myers**: $\text{Ric} \ge \kappa > 0 \implies \text{diam}(M) \le \pi/\sqrt{\kappa}$
1234: - **Hyperbolic surfaces**: Genus $g \ge 2 \implies$ admits metric with constant $K = -1$
1235: 
1236: **Both frameworks use**:
1237: - Delaunay triangulation (simplicial complex structure)
1238: - Voronoi tessellation (dual structure for volumes)
1239: - Deficit angles (link curvature to Euler characteristic)
1240: - Plaquette holonomy (Riemann tensor and Chern numbers)

hints.label: rem-topological-phase-transitions
hints.title: Topological Phase Transitions in Optimization
hints.content:
1248: :label: rem-topological-phase-transitions
1249: 
1250: **Hypothesis**: During optimization, the swarm configuration undergoes **topological phase transitions** detectable via Betti numbers.
1251: 
1252: **Phase 1: Exploration** ($t \approx 0$):
1253: - $\beta_0$ large (many disconnected clusters)
1254: - $\beta_1$ small (sparse connectivity)
1255: - High genus (rugged landscape exploration)
1256: 
1257: **Phase 2: Clustering** ($t \approx T/2$):
1258: - $\beta_0$ decreases (clusters merge)
1259: - $\beta_1$ increases (walkers form connected network)
1260: - Topology simplifies (focus on promising regions)
1261: 
1262: **Phase 3: Convergence** ($t \approx T$):
1263: - $\beta_0 = 1$ (single connected component)
1264: - $\beta_1 \to 0$ (tree-like structure, no cycles)
1265: - Genus $g \to 0$ (contractible configuration)
1266: 
1267: **Algorithmic use**:
1268: - **Early termination**: If $\beta_0 = 1$ and $\beta_1 = 0$ early, swarm has converged

hints.label: rem-future-topology
hints.title: Future Directions
hints.content:
1276: :label: rem-future-topology
1277: 
1278: **Theoretical**:
1279: 1. **Topological convergence theorem**: Prove that $\beta_k(S_t) \to \beta_k(\mathcal{A})$ as $t \to \infty$, where $\mathcal{A}$ is the attractor set
1280: 2. **Bottleneck distance bounds**: Relate algorithmic performance to bottleneck distance $d_B(H_1(S_t), H_1(S_{t'}))$
1281: 3. **Homotopy invariants**: Characterize when configuration space homotopy non-trivial
1282: 
1283: **Computational**:
1284: 1. **Online TDA**: Incremental persistent homology updates as walkers move
1285: 2. **Sparse methods**: Exploit Delaunay sparsity for faster homology computation
1286: 3. **GPU acceleration**: Parallelize boundary matrix reduction
1287: 
1288: **Applications**:
1289: 1. **Adaptive cloning**: Use $\beta_1$ to detect bottlenecks and focus cloning
